div.div: Ἄντι-φος : (1) a son of Priam, Il. 4.489.—(2) son of Aegyptius, Od. 2.19.— (3) a friend of Odysseus, Od. 17.68.—(4) son of Talaemenes, an ally of the Trojans, Il. 2.864.—(5) a Heraclid, son of Thessalus, a leader of Greek islanders, Il. 2.678.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
